clinical_study.brief_title: Mandibular Overdentures Retained by Conventional or Mini Implants
clinical_study.official_title: Mandibular Overdentures Retained by Conventional or Mini Implants: a Randomized Clinical Trial

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to compare mandibular overdentures retained either by mini or standard size implants as a treatment for edentulous adults, in terms of patient-reported satisfaction and oral health-related quality of life. We will also evaluate post surgical discomfort, the success rate of prostheses and implants in the long term, denture quality and costs.

primary_outcome.description: To be assessed by specific questionnaires
To be assessed by means of the Brazilian version of the OHIP-EDENT.

secondary_outcome.description: Pain and discomfort following the insertion of dental implants, as assessed by a specific questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Success rate of implant-retained mandibular overdentures

secondary_outcome.description: Functional aspects of mandibular overdentures, as assessed by a dentist.

arm_group.description: Retention of an overdenture by means of 4 mini implants.
Retention of an overdenture by means of 2 mini implants.
Retention of an overdenture by means of 2 conventional implants associated to ball attachments.

intervention.description: Insertion of implants in the lower arch in order to retain existing complete dentures. Tested implants are approved by the Brazilian National Health Surveillance Agency for clinical use.
